message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the decomposition process after death. When a living organism dies, bacteria begin to break down the body, leading to decomposition. Option (A), spirits, is a belief held by some religions or cultures but is not universally accepted or proven. Option (C), God, is a subjective belief and is not directly related to the decomposition process. Option (D), food, is not present in the body after death because digestion and nutrient absorption ceases.
